etymology.description: 围 + 棋 = encirclement board game (Go).
etymology.interpretation: Combines 围 ‘to surround’ with 棋 ‘board game,’ pointing to the game’s core objective of surrounding territory. Highlights encirclement as the defining strategy of Go.
etymology.simplification: Component simplification: 圍 → 围 by replacing 韋 with its simplified form 韦 inside the 囗 enclosure; 棋 unchanged.

parts.english: to surround; to encircle; to besiege; enclosure
board game; chess; Go; game piece

examples.chinese: 我从小喜欢下围棋(我從小喜歡下圍棋)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ cóng xiǎo xǐhuān xià wéiqí.
examples.english: I’ve liked playing Go since childhood.

examples.chinese: 围棋强调“围地”(圍棋強調「圍地」)，胜负取决于谁控制更多的地盘(勝負取決於誰控制更多的地盤)。
examples.pinyin: Wéiqí qiángdiào “wéidì”, shèngfù qǔjué yú shéi kòngzhì gèng duō de dìpán.
examples.english: Go emphasizes ‘encircling territory’; victory depends on who controls more territory.

examples.chinese: 周末我们去棋院参加围棋比赛(週末我們去棋院參加圍棋比賽)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò wǒmen qù qíyuàn cānjiā wéiqí bǐsài.
examples.english: On the weekend we go to the Go institute to take part in a Go tournament.
